verses.text: 1 "JESUS_END"I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

2 "JESUS_END"I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-3/" title="Song of Solomon 5:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3  "JESUS_END"I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?
4 "JESUS_END"My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.
5 "JESUS_END"I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.
6 "JESUS_END"I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-7/" title="Song of Solomon 5:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7  "JESUS_END"The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.
8 "JESUS_END"I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love.
9 "JESUS_END"What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? what is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?
10 "JESUS_END"My beloved is white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.
11 "JESUS_END"His head is as the most fine gold, his locks are bushy, and black as a raven.
12 "JESUS_END"His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set.
13 "JESUS_END"His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
14 "JESUS_END"His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: his belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.
15 "JESUS_END"His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.
16 "JESUS_END"His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.
